Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: To be left behind without support or assistance
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Refers to soldiers camping alone without reinforcement in Malagasy history
First Example Sentence: Tsy avelako ianao hanao toby an-tanety amin'ity raharaha ity.
Second Example Sentence: Niala ny mpiara-miasa ka dia manao toby an-tanety aho izao.
Third Example Sentence: Raha tsy misy fanampiana, dia hanao toby an-tanety tanteraka isika.

Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: To make promises or statements that carry no real weight
First Example Sentence: Ny teniny dia toy ny mihinana am-bava tsy lanin’ny kibo ihany.
Second Example Sentence: Politika maro no mihinana am-bava tsy lanin’ny kibo.
Third Example Sentence: Tsy azo itokisana ny olona mihinana am-bava tsy lanin’ny kibo.

Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: A poor person who always has someone to respond or defend them
First Example Sentence: Na dia tsy manan-kohanina aza izy, dia manan-kavaly hatrany.
Second Example Sentence: Tsy manan-kohanina fa manan-kavaly aho noho ny fianakaviana.
Third Example Sentence: Olona maro no tsy manan-kohanina fa manan-kavaly eny an-tanàna.

Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: To fall into trouble or danger
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Originates from rural Malagasy life where pits were dug to trap animals
First Example Sentence: Mety latsaka an-kady ianao raha tsy mitandrina.
Third Example Sentence: Tsy tiako ianao hamerina latsaka an-kady indray.

Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: To be dressed but not respectably; lacking true dignity
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent: To appear well but lack substance
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: References social status and appearance in Malagasy culture
First Example Sentence: Toy ny manao akanjo tsy mba lamba ilay mpanankarena sandoka.
Second Example Sentence: Manao akanjo tsy mba lamba ny fihetsiny amin’ny vahoaka.
Third Example Sentence: Tsy tian’ny olona manao akanjo tsy mba lamba ao amin’ny fivoriana.

Idiom (Malagasy): Ny valala tsy indroa mandry am-bavahady
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Ancient proverb linked to the natural behavior of locusts
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Malagasy): ni valalə tsʲ indrua manˈdrʲ amˈbavaɡadʲ
First Example Sentence: Aza avela handalo, fa ny valala tsy indroa mandry am-bavahady.
Second Example Sentence: Zava-dehibe ny fahafahana, satria ny valala tsy indroa mandry am-bavahady.
Third Example Sentence: Nampahatsiahy azy aho fa ny valala tsy indroa mandry am-bavahady.

Non-Idiomatic Equivalent: To resist or fight back directly
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Derived from cattle culture; a bull resisting while being tied
First Example Sentence: Nitsipaka an-kitsirano ny fepetra napetraky ny governemanta.
Second Example Sentence: Mitsipaka an-kitsirano ny mpiasa amin’ny tsy rariny.

Idiom (Malagasy): Mandeha amin’ny tongotra anoloana sy aoriana
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Alludes to someone acting like a crab moving backward and forward
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Malagasy): manˈde amʲˈni tuŋɡutr anuluanə si awˈrianə
First Example Sentence: Ny fanapahan-keviny dia mandeha amin’ny tongotra anoloana sy aoriana.
Second Example Sentence: Mandeha amin’ny tongotra anoloana sy aoriana ny fitondrana.
Third Example Sentence: Tsy misy vahaolana mandeha amin’ny tongotra anoloana sy aoriana.

Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Faisana refers to weeds, figuratively meaning obstacles
First Example Sentence: Mitondra faisana hatrany amin’ny asa andavanandro izy.
Second Example Sentence: Ny fahantrana dia mitondra faisana ho an’ny maro.
Third Example Sentence: Mitondra faisana hatrany izahay rehefa misy olana lehibe.

Idiom (Malagasy): Mananihany toy ny rano tsy miangatra
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Refers to the natural impartiality of water flowing
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Malagasy): mananihanʲ tuj ni ˈranʷ tsʲ miˈaŋɡatə
First Example Sentence: Ny lehilahy ao an-trano dia mananihany toy ny rano tsy miangatra.
Second Example Sentence: Tsy nitsahatra izy mananihany toy ny rano tsy miangatra.
Third Example Sentence: Fomban-dry zareo ny mananihany toy ny rano tsy miangatra amin’ny fotoana rehetra.
